jobDescription: Neurodegenerative Behavior Position - Qualified candidate must be a motivated, talented and disciplined scientist having excellent expertise in behaviorally assessing various rodent models of neurodegenerative disease. In addition the successful candidate should have prior experience with stereotaxic surgeries in rodents. Applicants must possess a Ph.D. degree in Neuroscience or a related field, or MS with at least 5 to 10 years of experience. Superior communication skills, experience in motivating and supervising junior Research Associates, ability to multi-task and a demonstrated record of accomplishment are a must. Applicant must be willing to work in the back with junior Research Associates, providing scientific and technical support. Requirements: Knowledgable in performing experiments using behavior assays assessing motor and cognitive dysfunction; Strong Stereotaxic and general surgery skills are a must; Excel in data handling, including statistical analysis; Hands on experience with rodent handling, tissue dissection, blood collection, drug administration (IV, IP, PO, ICV) are required. Ensure that presentations and reports are available to clients in a timely manner. Contribute to manuscript preparation as needed. Demonstrate strong leadership skills, train and supervise scientists as needed. Major plus: Background in neurodegenerative research with in vivo molecular and pharmacological expertise.
